intro: Psychotria albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded conditions and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Psychotria albiflora is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
